title: Trump Says He Is Commuting George Santos’s Prison Sentence for Fraud
summary: George Santos, the disgraced Republican congressman, had been sentenced to prison after his web of deceit unraveled. He was the sixth member of the House to be expelled.

title: A Timeline of George Santos’s Rise and Fall
summary: The disgraced former congressman was sentenced to prison, years after his credentials and career began to unravel. Then President Trump commuted his sentence.

title: George Santos, Disgraced Former Congressman, Still Wants Your Attention
summary: After his lies and expulsion from Congress, and before his sentencing in February, George Santos chases the limelight with a party and a podcast.

title: Prosecutor Who Rejected Trump’s Pressure to Charge James Is Fired
summary: The dismissal was the latest fallout from attempts by career Justice Department officials to impede the president’s wide-ranging campaign of retribution. The prosecutor’s deputy was also fired.

title: Higher Obamacare Prices Become Public in a Dozen States
summary: Consumers are facing greater costs for their 2026 A.C.A. health coverage as Congress continues to debate whether to extend subsidies that help people afford their premiums.

title: University of Virginia Won’t Join White House’s Compact for Colleges
summary: It was the fifth school in a matter of days to refuse an offer of preferential funding treatment from the government, even as the White House has threatened schools that do not sign up.

title: Senators Move to Force Vote to Bar Ground Strikes in Venezuela
summary: The bid comes after the Senate rejected a similar measure to curb President Trump’s attacks against alleged drug runners in the Caribbean Sea.

title: Maps: Where the U.S. Is Building Up Military Force in the Caribbean
summary: About 10,000 U.S. troops and dozens of military aircraft and ships are in the region as the Trump administration increases pressure on Venezuela.

title: U.S. Detains 2 Survivors of Latest Military Strike in Caribbean
summary: The capture of prisoners presents a major new set of legal and policy problems for the Trump administration in its escalating campaign.

title: Diane Keaton’s Legacy as a House Renovator and Flipper
summary: Known for her roles in film, the actress built a second act off-screen, turning the homes she renovated into another stage.

title: Benioff Apologizes for Saying Trump Should Send Troops to San Francisco
summary: Marc Benioff, the chief executive of Salesforce, said he no longer believed that National Guard troops were needed in the city.

title: Judge Orders Some Federal Agents to Wear Body Cameras in Chicago Area
summary: The order comes as the Trump administration has carried out an immigration crackdown in the region.

title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Allow National Guard Deployment in Chicago Area
summary: The president has mobilized state-based military forces to U.S. cities over the objections of state and local officials.

title: Tennessee Officials Sue Over National Guard Presence in Memphis
summary: Backed by a liberal-leaning legal nonprofit, seven Tennessee officials filed a lawsuit on Friday challenging the deployment of troops in Memphis.

title: Prince Andrew Surrenders Duke of York Title Amid Epstein Fallout
summary: The royal’s fall from grace began nearly six years ago with a calamitous BBC television interview about his ties to the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Despite Gaza Cease-Fire, Aid Deliveries Struggle
summary: A single photograph of Palestinians besieging an aid convoy after the new cease-fire took hold in Gaza makes clear how much work lies ahead in the enclave.

title: A Beloved Zoo of Misfit Animals Is Almost Out of Money
summary: It went from one of the worst zoos in America to a beloved menagerie filled with disabled and elderly native species. Now it may close for good.

title: Alaska Governor Says Storm Recovery Could Keep Evacuees Away for 18 Months
summary: After the remnants of a typhoon devastated villages in western Alaska, Gov. Mike Dunleavy asked President Trump for federal help in the recovery process.

title: How a Long Island Woman Was Diagnosed With Chikungunya
summary: A Long Island woman had no idea what had hit her. Her pursuit of an answer led to a mosquito-borne disease rarely seen in the United States.

title: Three Cases of Mpox Tied to Severe Illness Worry Health Experts
summary: None of the patients, all California residents, had traveled abroad, suggesting the Clade 1 form was transmitted locally.

title: For $900, This Subway Seat Could Be Yours
summary: The annual pop-up sale of retired signs and other transit artifacts from the New York City subway system attracted a line of collectors that stretched for blocks.

title: Mamdani ‘Might Be Eaten Alive’: 3 Opinion Writers on Who Won the Mayoral Debate
summary: Who lost the debate may be clearer than who won.

title: How Baby Boomers Blew Up the American Dream
summary: The postwar generation had a good run. Now we’re all paying for it.

title: Zelensky Pressed Trump for New Weapons
summary: Also, the Treasury secretary is betting big on Argentina. Here’s the latest at the end of Friday.

title: Vermont Legislator Resigns Over Racist Republican Texts
summary: The G.O.P. officials who participated in a group chat have faced calls to step down. State Senator Samuel Douglass was the group’s only elected member.

title: Wikipedia Volunteers Avert Tragedy by Taking Down Gunman at Conference
summary: After the man walked onto the stage at the “Wiki World’s Fair” event and threatened to kill himself, witnesses said, two members of the audience jumped in to stop him.

title: After Facing Life in Prison, a Legal Trailblazer Steps Into Freedom
summary: James Comer’s case helped end de facto life sentences for young offenders in New Jersey. He had been convicted of felony murder as a teenager, after his companion in a robbery shot a victim.

title: Drought Mutes Northeast Leaf-Peeping Season
summary: A prolonged drought and other factors have muffled the kaleidoscopic blend of reds, oranges and yellows in some areas of New England this fall.
